snippet: The man faces charges of accessory to the murder of at least 170,000 people, as Germany presses on with efforts to bring elderly Nazis to justice for their role in the Holocaust.
abstract: German court rules 93-year-old Reinhold H, former SS sergeant whose full name is withheld for privacy, is fit to stand trial on accessory to murder charges for deaths of 170,000 people killed while he was Auschwitz camp guard.
lead_paragraph: The man faces charges of accessory to the murder of at least 170,000 people, as Germany presses on with efforts to bring elderly Nazis to justice for their role in the Holocaust.

headline.main: German Court Deems Ex-Guard at Auschwitz, 93, Fit to Stand Trial
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Ex-Nazi May Stand Trial

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
